Bylaw.definition: a rule adopted by an organization chiefly for the government of its members and the management of its affairs 2
Bylaw.origin: [Middle English bilage bilawe local law, probably ultimately from Old Norse b»≥r town + lg law]

1.definition: a rule adopted by an organization chiefly for the government of its members and the management of its affairs

2.definition: a local ordinance often used in pl.
